metadata.name: Distant Skies #151
metadata.description:
What awaits us in the vast expanse of our universe? Many have travelled our world, and gazed upon landscapes that seemed otherworldly, but you have the chance to see a landscape that is otherworldly.

18 Planets
A variety of ratios for your image
An infinite number of cloud and star variations
A 1% chance to glimpse signs of Alien Life
A 10% chance of a binary solar system

Press ’s’ to save a png

metadata.name: Annum #6325
metadata.description:
This project is being released in celebration of the 1 year aniversary of Achromat, my first release on fxhash. In addition to being inspired by Achromat, aspects of other previous projects have been incorporated. My deepest gratitude to all who have collected my work over the past year.

In live mode, add &size=<YOUR_PIXEL_SIZE> to change the pixel size of the image for export (Right click to save). For example, &size=4000 will set the width of the image to be 4000 pixels.

50% of primary sales go to Savepakistan.

metadata.name: Balancium #701
metadata.description:
"Balancium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at Art Basel, Basel 2022

In the fall of 1931, in Alexander Calder's studio, Marcel Duchamp coined the term 'mobile' for his kinetic sculptures. Later, Calder wrote: "This, in French, means not only 'movable'— but also a 'motive', 'a reason for an act' so I found it a very good word."
 
Around the same year, Bruno Munari started making colorful and whimsical mobiles. He called them "useless machines", existing without any purpose and inviting viewers to just look. Elements are connected with nearly invisible threads or wires, allowing the artist to create the illusion of shapes floating in the air.

Balancium is both a virtual mobile and a useless object. Generated by the code, it undergoes a continual transformation. The movement of the air, or invisible fluid, becomes an integral part of the design and amplifies serenity. 
 
There is a keyboard key that unlocks more variations.

metadata.name: Digital Gardens #213
metadata.description:
Digital Gardens are places of magic and wonder, where you can connect with your inner nature and take a deep breath. Digital Gardens are a refuge from the world outside. A sanctuary for the mind, body, and soul. But they are also a place of play and exploration. It is a space where you can let your imagination run wild, creating and discovering new things.
Digital Gardens brings to life the minimalistic essence of Detegus’ art and the abstract and rational art of Alfredo Boaron.
The gardens are generated from a recursive function dividing the space at each iteration with a proportion that follows the Fibonacci succession and randomly stops after some iterations. At each recursion the canvas is divided into two pieces following the proportion of two consecutive Fibonacci numbers [1 to 144].
The minimalistic visual effect is then personalized by the palettes of 15 artists who embraced the invitation to give their personal contribution to the collection. The palette name and the author name is displayed in the features along with the Fibonacci numbers ratio, the colors number vs the total palette color number, the background color, the total number of rectangles and the depth level of recursion achieved by the algorithm.
Immerse yourself in this generative project, inspired by geometrism and abstract expressionism. 
Lose yourself in the beauty of a digital garden.

- - - 

Artists palettes
Bajiru's Winter - Bajiru - @bajirudenwa
Believers - Luigi Stranieri - @klunk22
Bloodline - Goldcat - @OriginalGoldCat
Blue Berry - Anna Beller - @Anna___Beller
Blues - The Crow - @crow8138
Bonbon - Lammetje - @lammetje_nl
Desert Sunset - Letmesee - @LetMeSee63
Hilma - Danielle King - @Rrose_Selavy_11
Metadavid - Metadavid - @metadavideth
Mysterious colors - Hoiz - @hooiizz
Nepenthe - Senem - @hiceku
Shades Of Disaster - No Faith - @no_faith_left
The Captain - Studio Captain - @StudioCaptain1
Tsubaki - Nina - @ninacrypto2
Zen Garden - Tim Oliver Schweizer - @vortacorg

- - -

Keyboard shortcuts
- Press [a] to save at 5000 x 5000 px resolution
- Press [b] to save at 10000 x 10000 px resolution
- Press [c] to save at 15000 x 15000 px resolution

AB & D
;-)

metadata.name: yukt #47
metadata.description:
Hey Guys, this is my new project "yukt". The art is created with p5js, math and random.

Press 's' or 'S' to save image as jpg and 'p' or 'P' to save as png in default quality.
Add scale=print& before fxhash in the URL to save image in high quality.
Add scale=print2& before fxhash in the URL to save image in highest quality.

Example:
Before: https://gateway.fxhash2.xyz/ipfs/QmYiErKegzf66TgVB...../?fxhash=ooXFx4Cbn23Sacb...
After: https://gateway.fxhash2.xyz/ipfs/QmYiErKegzf66TgVB...../?scale=print&fxhash=ooXFx4Cbn23Sacb...

Note: Art can take some minutes to render and check console for more details.

Art: Nov 2022
Created By: ArtLife
Twitter: https://twitter.com/iamPraveenIN

The shadows of the future are the light I emit now, and
I can only keep moving forward towards the core of the planet.

metadata.name: 𝖚𝖑𝖙𝖗𝖆zone 0.1 #4
metadata.description: "After 500 steps, the PA will sound: "Ding-dong!" just as if the player were still in the 𝖚𝖑𝖙𝖗𝖆zone. The player will then be returned to the 𝖚𝖑𝖙𝖗𝖆zone building, regardless of where they were before" Created in 2022.

metadata.name: How to Draw Bubbles (◕‿◕)♡ #254
metadata.description:
[The solidness or volume of the form could be obtained by using highlights on one side of each object and shading on the opposite side.]


(⊃｡•́‿•̀｡)⊃━━━━☆


With only a few colorful lines near the edges and bright accents in the oposite corners, one rounded polygon becomes a shiny and bright voluminous surface. It's easy! 

Look out for the FOMO keyboard key to unlock more variations.




Wishing you easy, light and bubbly 2023! 
(◕‿◕)♡

metadata.name: assumption #10
metadata.description:
assumption, 2023

The most flexible part is that dominates the system.

Simple patterns or complex designs, each gesture brings a new possibility, expanding borders and revealing new paths.


- Press “s” or "S" to save .png

Generative Token by Morbeck (@morbeck_art) for fxhash.
Made with p5.js and p5.grain. January 2023.

metadata.name: Artifact #424
metadata.description:
This project is about uncovering artifacts.

Each piece is determined by approximately 15 parameters. This allows for a multitude of possible forms, and each iteration is an artifact to be discovered within the multidimensional space.

This work is focused around discovery. It is about exploring the space of the algorithm, shedding light on its many forms, and sometimes finding artifacts of the real world embedded within them.

Technically, this work is a composition of three primary elements: Voronoi tessellations, orthographic projection, and the depth-sort algorithm.
The latter of these is integral to the rendering mechanism. It works intuitively, drawing distant objects before near objects, evaluating the distance of each object according to its geometric center. It does this precisely, and in doing so, it can produce interesting visual artifacts, drawing some shapes in an unexpected order.



This has been a fascinating study, bringing light to unreal shapes and forms, and uncovering artifacts in an impossible space.

I hope you enjoy it,
Nat Sarkissian





Technical Notes:
- Append “&mag=N” to the end of the URL in live mode to specify a resolution multiplier. It will render the image N times larger than the size of your window. If you have specified anything greater than 1, a download will start automatically once the rendering is done.

objkt.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #118

metadata.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents #118
metadata.description:
“If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.”

― Edsger W. Dijkstra


This artwork is dedicated to happy accidents, mistakes, and bugs. Every key part of it is based on some sort of failure: wrong variable value, unstopped recursion, untimely function call. And sometimes it leads to pleasant results.

It was created to celebrate #fxhashturnsone event.

The earnings are partly donated to:
- Processing Foundation
- #TezosStandsWithUkraine

[a] - toggle animation
[1] - save PNG in low resolution
[2] - save PNG in medium resolution
[3] - save PNG in high resolution
[4] - save PNG in ultra-high resolution

Saving with high and ultra-high resolution may take a while, please be patient.


Made with love and p5js

By Collapsar Beauty
CC BY-NC-ND 4.0

issuer.name: Ode to Bugs and Happy Accidents

metadata.name: Hyper Pixel #229
metadata.description:
Somewhere between pixel-art and axonometric architectural projections, spatial compositions assembled from multi-resolution pixel precise fragments. 

Hyper Pixel is the result of a continued interest in using projections to represent three dimensional object in  two dimensional picture image, and embracing the fact that all digital images are two dimensional arrays of discrete pixels. In that sense it is also a reaction against both skeuomorphism, or mimicking older media in digital form, and the push towards ever increasing fidelity and resolution. The project uses Military perspective, a form of oblique projection, or 45° - 45° axonometric projection, because these angels can approximated fittingly by square pixel grid. 

Press s, m, l, x for exporting an image with increasing resolution.
Press p for pause.
Press r for refresh.

Made with P5.js by @introspect0r

metadata.name: Microgravity #677
metadata.description:
Microgravity is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022.

Scale symmetry of abstract semiliquid forms.

Click on a section of the image to explore deeper.
- Use keys [0-9] to change the detail level.
- Use the "S" key to save a PNG image.
- Use the "R" key to reset the coordinates.
